content:
cds-hooks-bot opened Issue #254

## May 2018 Ballot Comment 48

Submitted by @bvdh from Philips Healthcare

Chapter: CDS Services
Section: Passing the Access Token to the CDS Service
Type: NEG :exclamation:
In Person Requested? Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Existing Wording:

If your CDS Service has no decision support for the user, your service should SHALL return a 200 HTTP response with an empty array of cards.

Comment:
need to include behavior for error conditions

## Triage Information

Triage Notes:
Reviewed with Bas

Proposed Disposition: Persuasive
Proposed Disposition Comment:
We will document that errors are possible (normal HTTP status) in the CDS Service Response section. We will just document the error codes that are possible (any/all HTTP statuses) but not the behavior expected from the EHR or CDS Service.

_This issue was imported by @cds-hooks-bot from the consolidated CDS Hooks May 2018 ballot spreadsheet._

cds-hooks-bot edited Issue #254

## May 2018 Ballot Comment 48

Submitted by @bvdh from Philips Healthcare

Chapter: CDS Services
Section: Passing the Access Token to the CDS Service
Type: NEG :exclamation:
In Person Requested? Yes :bust_in_silhouette:

Existing Wording:

If your CDS Service has no decision support for the user, your service should SHALL return a 200 HTTP response with an empty array of cards.

Comment:
need to include behavior for error conditions

## Triage Information

Triage Notes:
Reviewed with Bas

Proposed Disposition: Persuasive
Proposed Disposition Comment:
We will document that errors are possible (normal HTTP status) in the CDS Service Response section. We will just document the error codes that are possible (any/all HTTP statuses) but not the behavior expected from the EHR or CDS Service.

_This issue was imported by @cds-hooks-bot from the consolidated CDS Hooks May 2018 ballot spreadsheet._

cds-hooks-bot commented on Issue #254

Proposed Disposition: Persuasive
Proposed Disposition Comment:
We will document that errors are possible (normal HTTP status) in the CDS Service Response section. We will just document the error codes that are possible (any/all HTTP statuses) but not the behavior expected from the EHR or CDS Service.

cds-hooks-bot commented on Issue #254

## :telephone_receiver: CDS Working Group Block Vote (5-30-2018)

Meeting notes: http://wiki.hl7.org/index.php?title=File:2018-05-30_CDS_WG_Call_Minutes.docx

Julia Skapik moved the following disposition, seconded by @brynrhodes.

Disposition: Persuasive
Disposition Comment:
We will document that errors are possible (normal HTTP status) in the CDS Service Response section. We will just document the error codes that are possible (any/all HTTP statuses) but not the behavior expected from the EHR or CDS Service.

:+1: For: 12
:expressionless: Abstain: 0
:-1: Against: 0

:tada: The motion passed! :tada:
